intro: Dubois-reymondia punctata, commonly known as the punctate spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy cyathium inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and features alternate, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are surrounded by specialized bracts that serve to attract pollinators. The species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological benefits in native gardens.
